note.p: Birth: Buckingham Palace, London, England (27 January 1773)

Education: Career: Freemason, initiated 20 December 1798, Lodge 'zur siegenden Wahreit' [Victorious Truth] No 14, subsequently No 185, in Berlin, one of four formed when Royal York Lodge of Friendship split for that purpose, passed 19 January 1799 and raised 4 February 1800.
Honours: KG 1786; Baron Arklow, Earl of Inverness and Duke of Sussex 1801
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1843 No 58 pp 484-485
References: R K Bluhm, 'A Note on the Origin of the Society's Conversaziones' in NR 1958 vol 13 pp 61-63
L F Gilbert, 'The Election to the Presidency of the Royal Society in 1820' in NR 1954-55 vol 11 pp 256-279
L Pearce Williams, 'The Royal Society and the Founding of the British Association for the Advancement of Science' in NR 1961 vol 16 pp 221-233
The Library and Museum of Freemasonry, 'Freemasons and the Royal Society. Alphabetical List of Fellows of the Royal Society who were Freemasons' 2010, page 27
